text: When the government gives up its ownership and control of a business to individuals, this is known as
explanation: privatization; is the transfer of a business, industry, or service from public to private ownership and control.

text: The reward received by a party in a contract agreement is known as
explanation: Consideration is a vital element in the law of contracts, consideration is a benefit which must be bargained for between the parties, and is the essential reason for a party entering into a contract.payment or money.

text: Payment to a ship owner for carrying one's cargo is
explanation: Freight is a payment for goods transported in bulk by truck, train, ship, or aircraft.

text: Which of the following is not pre-sale service?

options.B: Providing detailed information about the goods to be purchased
options.C: Demonstrating the use and performance of the products to be sold
options.D: Setting up facilities for storing the product to be bought

explanation: Repair and maintenance work is an after sales service

text: Which of the following is used to inform the addressee that he has a registered parcel for collection?
explanation: click here

text: The co-operative society that performs a combination of the functions of other types of cooperatives is called
explanation: multi-purpose cooperative-combines 2 or more of the business activities of these different types of cooperatives, e.g credit lending and production, production and provision of goods and services, etc.

text: That portion of the share capital which the company has asked the shareholders to pay for is known as
explanation: Called up share capital is shares issued to investors, under the understanding that the shares will be paid for at a later date or in installments.

text: One of the advantages of air transport over other forms of transport is
explanation: Air transportation is the fastest means of transportation

text: Which of the following are elements of a valid contract?
explanation: Offer and Acceptance. An offer occurs when one party presents something of value that they wish to exchange for something else of value. And the other party must be willing to accept the offer before the contract can be considered valid

text: The last link in the channel of distribution is the
explanation: The consumer is the last link in the channel of distribution. Production and distribution is complete only when goods reaches the final consumer

text: Taxes on imported foreign goods are also known as
explanation: Atariffis a tax imposed by one country on the goods and services imported from another country

text: If Karamo who lives in The Gambia imports goods from Senegal and later sells them in Guinea Bissau; Karamo is engaged in
explanation: Entreport is a trade in which imported goods are re-exported with or without any additional processing or repackaging.

text: Manufacturers may sell goods directly to consumers where goods are i. made to customer's specification ii. advertised by the manufacturer iii. perishable iv. highly technical v. widely demanded
explanation: Manufacturers may decide to sell directly to consumers if the good are;- made to customer's specification- perishable- Highly technical

text: Which of the following is a means of payment?
explanation: A postal order is an order for payment of a specified sum to a named payee, issued by the Post Office.

text: Shipping services rendered by Nigeria to The Gambia would be classified by The Gambia as
explanation: Invisible import is any service, such as banking, insurance and tourism, that cannot be seen and recorded as it crosses boundaries between countries.

text: The main divisions of production are
explanation: Production has 3 main divisions- Extraction- manufacturing- construction

text:
A trader's turnover was D36,000. Purchases was D28,000. The opening stock was D2,000 and the closing stock was D3,000.

What is the cost of goods sold?
explanation:
Starting inventory + purchases - ending inventory =cost of goods sold.
2000 + 28000 - 3000 = 27000

text:
A trader's turnover was D36,000. Purchases was D28,000. The opening stock was D2,000 and the closing stock was D3,000.

What is the cost of goods sold?
explanation: Starting inventory + purchases - ending inventory =cost of goods sold.2000 + 28000 - 3000 = 27,000

text:
A trader's turnover was D36,000. Purchases was D28,000. The opening stock was D2,000 and the closing stock was D3,000.

The average stock is
explanation: Average stock = opening stock + closing stock / 22000 + 3000 = 50005000 / 2 = 2500

text:
A trader's turnover was D36,000. Purchases was D28,000. The opening stock was D2,000 and the closing stock was D3,000.

What is the rate of turnover?
explanation:
The inventory turnover ratio is calculated by dividing the cost of goods sold for a period by the average inventory for that period
COGS / average stock = Rate of turnover
cogs = opening stock + purchases - closing stock2000 + 28000 - 3000 = 27000
Average stock = opening stock + closing stock / 22000 + 3000 / 2 = 2500
Rate of turnover = 27000/ 2500 = 10.8 times

text: In marine insurance, when a particular cargo is thrown into the sea in order to prevent the ship from sinking, the type of marine loss is
explanation: General AverageLosses — maritime partial losses sustained from voluntary sacrifice, such as jettisoning part of the cargo, to save the ship or crew, or from extraordinary expenses incurred by one of the parties for everyone's benefit, such as the cost to tow a disabled vessel.

text: The turnover of a trade is the

options.A: number of times the stock is sold
options.B: total sales made during a period
options.D: total purchases made during the period

explanation: Turnoveris an accounting concept that calculates how quickly a business conducts its operations. Most often, turnover is used to understand how quickly a company collects cash from accounts receivable or how fast the company sells its inventory.

text: The total assets of a business less its total liability is known as
explanation: Capital owned: This is the excess of value of asset of a business over its liability. It is the net worth of a business.Capital owned = assets - liabilities

text: A document issued to the public by a company to advertise its share is known as
explanation: A prospectus is a formal document that is required by and filed with the Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) that provides details about an investment offering to the public.

text: An overdraft is

options.A: amount permitted to be withdrawn in excess of one's deposit
options.B: excessive cash withdrawn by commercial banks from the Central Bank
options.C: credit balance standing in the name of a customer
options.D: special deposits made by commercial banks

explanation: The term bank overdraft refers to a withdrawal of money that is greater than the available balance in an account.

text: Which of the following is not a principle of insurance
explanation:
There are seven basic principles that create an insurance contract between the insured and the insurer:
Utmost Good FaithInsurable InterestProximate CauseIndemnitySubrogationContributionLoss Minimization

text: The par value of a share is also known as its
explanation: Nominal value of a security, often referred to as face or par value, is its redemption price and is normally stated on the front of that security.

text: A cheque dated 15th March 2012, will become stale on
explanation: A cheque is valid for 6 months after it's issued. If it was issued on 15 march, it is valid till 16 September of the same year.

text: Banks settle their indebtedness in the
explanation: A clearing house is a bankers' establishment where cheques and bills from member banks are exchanged, so that only the balances need be paid in cash.

text: Which of the following distinguishes home trade from foreign trade?
explanation: In a home or domestic trade, payment for goods and services are less cumbersome and easily arranged unlike foreign trade that is prone with the problem of different currencies and exchange rate

text: Before the advent of legal tender and credit instrument, which of the following was used as a medium of exchanged?
explanation: Cowries where used as a medium of exchange by traders during the barter system. The cowrie currency had enabled the economy to overcome the inherent problems of the barter exchange system.

text: When C.I.F is quoted on an invoice, it means that the price includes the
explanation: CIF means Cost, Insurance, and Freight. That is ,the seller is obligated but not restricted to : Taking care of export customs clearance formalities at origin

text: Encouraging a high quality of members' products through the circulation of research information is a function of
explanation: Manufacturers Association of Nigeria also known as MAN is a trade group headquartered in Lagos. The group act as a platform that manufacturers use to influence economic, industrial, labour and social policy within Nigeria. They encouraging a high quality of members' products through the research

text: A voluntary association of business executives within a locality is known as
explanation: Chamber of commerce; a local association to promote and protect the interests of the business community in a particular place.

text: Which of the following is not a function of Ports Authority?

options.A: Providing facilities for loading and off-loading of vessels
options.C: Providing enough ships for the country

explanation: Option C is not a function of ports authority. Ships can be owned by anyone

text: Using symbols, letters, name or combination of these by a company to distinguish its products is
explanation: Trade mark is a symbol, word, or words legally registered or established by use as representing a company or product.

text: Trade as a division of commerce is usually classified into
explanation: Trade is divided into;- Home or domestic trade- Foreign or international trade

text: Liquid capital in a business means the
explanation: Liquid capital, or fluid capital is a readily convertible asset, such as money or other bearer economic instruments, as opposed to a long term asset like real estate.  It is the asset that is easily converted to cash

text: The relationship which subsists between between two or more persons carrying on a business with a view to profit" is
explanation: A partnership is an arrangement between two or more people to oversee business operations and share its profits and liabilities.

text: Rights issue is the

options.A: individual's right to be issued shares n subscription
options.B: right of shareholders to voteon issues
options.C: preferntial right to returns on shares
options.D: shares offered to existing shareholders at a cheaper price

explanation: Right isues is an issue of shares offered at a special price by a company to its existing shareholders in proportion to their holding of old shares.

text: The completion of the production process by grading and branding of goods is a function of the
explanation: Many wholesalers sort out goods according to size, shape, quality, etc. They break the goods into small lots, repack them and put their own brand names. In this way, they perform the functions of packing, branding and grading.

text: The development of commerce was encouraged by the desire to

options.A: get goods and services of others

explanation: The satisfaction of economic and human needs is the bedrock of commerce

text: Which of the following is not a member of the Lake Chad Basin Commission
explanation: The Lake Chad Basin Commission (LCBC) was established on 22nd of May 1964 by the four countries that border Lake Chad: Cameroon, Niger, Nigeria and Chad.

text: A false statement made by one party with an intention of inducing to enter into a contract with him is known as
explanation: A misrepresentation is a false statement of fact made by one party which affects the other party's decision in agreeing to acontract.

text: When consumers engage in actions that express dissatisfaction with the quantity, price and quality of goods available, such action is termed
explanation: Consumerism is a modern movement for the protection of the consumer against useless, inferior, or dangerous products, misleading advertising, unfair prices etc
